intro: Varronia stellata, commonly known as the starleaf tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Varronia stellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
